verses.text: For all this I considered in my heart even to declare all this, that the righteous , and the wise , and their works , \add are\add* in the hand of God : no man knoweth either love or hatred \add by\add* all \add that is\add* before them.\f + \fr 9.1 \ft I considered…: Heb. I gave, or, set to my heart\f*

All \add things come\add* alike to all: \add there is\add* one event to the righteous , and to the wicked ; to the good and to the clean , and to the unclean ; to him that sacrificeth , and to him that sacrificeth not: as \add is\add* the good , so \add is\add* the sinner ; \add and\add* he that sweareth , as \add he\add* that feareth an oath.

This \add is\add* an evil among all \add things\add* that are done under the sun , that \add there is\add* one event unto all: yea, also the heart of the sons of men is full of evil , and madness \add is\add* in their heart while they live , and after that \add they go\add* to the dead. \p
¶ For to him that is joined to all the living there is hope : for a living dog is better than a dead lion.
For the living know that they shall die : but the dead know not any thing , neither have they any more a reward ; for the memory of them is forgotten.
Also their love , and their hatred , and their envy , is now perished ; neither have they any more a portion for ever in any \add thing\add* that is done under the sun. \p
¶ Go thy way , eat thy bread with joy , and drink thy wine with a merry heart ; for God now accepteth thy works.
Let thy garments be always white ; and let thy head lack no ointment.

Live joyfully with the wife whom thou lovest all the days of the life of thy vanity , which he hath given thee under the sun , all the days of thy vanity : for that \add is\add* thy portion in \add this\add* life , and in thy labour which thou takest under the sun.\f + \fr 9.9 \ft Live…: Heb. See, or, Enjoy life\f*
Whatsoever thy hand findeth to do , do \add it\add* with thy might ; for \add there is\add* no work , nor device , nor knowledge , nor wisdom , in the grave , whither thou goest. \p

¶ I returned , and saw under the sun , that the race \add is\add* not to the swift , nor the battle to the strong , neither yet bread to the wise , nor yet riches to men of understanding , nor yet favour to men of skill ; but time and chance happeneth to them all.

For man also knoweth not his time : as the fishes that are taken in an evil net , and as the birds that are caught in the snare ; so \add are\add* the sons of men snared in an evil time , when it falleth suddenly upon them. \p
¶ This wisdom have I seen also under the sun , and it \add seemed\add* great unto me:
\add There was\add* a little city , and few men within it; and there came a great king against it, and besieged it, and built great bulwarks against it:
Now there was found in it a poor wise man , and he by his wisdom delivered the city ; yet no man remembered that same poor man.
Then said I, Wisdom \add is\add* better than strength : nevertheless the poor man’s wisdom \add is\add* despised , and his words are not heard.
The words of wise \add men are\add* heard in quiet more than the cry of him that ruleth among fools.
Wisdom \add is\add* better than weapons of war : but one sinner destroyeth much good.
